title: Business Development Manager - Public Sector
content:
A Business Development Manager at Thoughtworks is responsible for developing a pipeline of new opportunities, converting those opportunities into paid work, and helping establish the early relationship with the client.
The BDM typically engages with senior business and technology stakeholders at clients. Ideally you will have a track record of working and building relationships at the C-suite and senior management level, using a consultative selling approach to maximise customer outcomes. And you recognise that our people and our clients are at the centre of everything we do.

Job responsibilities


Leveraging the recent success in the public sector, convert new public sector target accounts in ANZ, creating the foundation for long-term, value-based relationships.
Create and execute pursuit strategies in collaboration with internal SMEs and specialists, and build propositions aligned with ours and our clients' values and needs.
Engage with client executives as a true business partner versus a software delivery partner, expanding our engagements to encompass the breadth and depth of our capabilities, including where appropriate, our world-leading global delivery centres and local First Nations Delivery Centre.

Success for the BDM role is defined as the sale of win-win value propositions that result in new business as well as nurturing executive relationships for continued or expanded business opportunities.

Job qualifications

Professional Skills


Able to develop a territory plan and a pipeline of new clients and client engagements.
Able to identify and prioritise target accounts and develop opportunities within these accounts.
Able to identify and qualify the right opportunities; confident to say no when it is not the right opportunity.
Able to create compelling solutions that address each organisation's unique challenges in close collaboration with internal SMEs and specialists.
Able to navigate, work and thrive in loosely structured, flat organisations.
Able to negotiate and persuade, winning the trust of senior executives to achieve the desired outcomes.
Retain a strong work ethic and an internal motivation and hunger to exceed targets.


Professional Experience


Experience selling custom software, human-centred design, and advisory services via high-performing teams to the public sector.
10+ years experience selling into state or federal Government in Australia, with a strong network of contacts in these sectors.
Experience engaging with C-level and senior management stakeholders on both the business and technology sides of organisations.



Other things to know

Learning & Development

There is no one-size-fits-all career path at Thoughtworks: however you want to develop your career is entirely up to you. But we also balance autonomy with the strength of our cultivation culture. This means your career is supported by interactive tools, numerous development programs and teammates who want to help you grow. We see value in helping each other be our best and that extends to empowering our employees in their career journeys.

Commitment to disability inclusion

Thoughtworks is committed to being an inclusive and accessible workplace employer of choice for all including those living with disability.

What's on offer

Our goal is to equip you with career defining experiences, to help you grow professionally and personally, and to foster a community where you feel you belong. We're committed to making Thoughtworks an employer of choice, and we offer a wide variety of benefits to support your advancement, your health and your wellbeing. For more information on these benefits and lots more, click here. If you're ready to find your home at Thoughtworks, click to apply now (even if you don't feel like you tick all the boxes)!


About Thoughtworks

Thoughtworks is a global technology consultancy that integrates strategy, design and engineering to drive digital innovation. For 30+ years, our clients have trusted our autonomous teams to build solutions that look past the obvious. Here, computer science grads come together with seasoned technologists, self-taught developers, midlife career changers and more to learn from and challenge each other. Career journeys flourish with the strength of our cultivation culture, which has won numerous awards around the world. Join Thoughtworks and thrive. Together, our extra curiosity, innovation, passion and dedication overcomes ordinary.

questions.label:
At Thoughtworks, we are intentional about making technology a better place for all. We know that the more diverse our backgrounds are, the more impactful solutions we build for our clients.

We foster an inclusive community and focus on creating a balanced workforce reflective of the society we live in. To help us achieve this balance, we encourage you to answer these demographic questions.

We collect this data to understand who we are reaching (and who we’re not) so we can do better at connecting with a truly diverse group of potential Thoughtworkers. This may also help us improve our interview or onboarding process.

Responding to the questions is completely voluntary. Declining to respond to some or all of these demographic questions will not impact your standing in the recruiting process. Your response will be treated with the strictest confidentiality and in accordance with our local data protection regulation.
Do you identify as an Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander person?

values.label: both Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander
